candidates.title: chore: release sdk, fvm, shared, and integration tests
candidates.body: This release includes a breaking change to the message/network context syscalls.

candidates.body: Includes some important bug fixes (that likely don't actually affect us, but still).

candidates.title: fix: patch funty for now
candidates.body: Upstream broke the world by yanking a version.

candidates.title: MEM-851: Memory expansion gas (to master)
candidates.body:
Resolves https://github.com/filecoin-project/ref-fvm/issues/851

This PR contains all the commits from https://github.com/filecoin-project/ref-fvm/pull/1058 cherry-picked and updated against `master`, and an additional update to point at the original test-vectors for conformance tests, rather than the v7 PR - a somewhat moot point because conformance tests on this branch are disabled until test vectors can be extracted.

TODO: 
- [x] Conclude the review of https://github.com/filecoin-project/ref-fvm/pull/1058
- [x] Cherry pick any additional fixes that came out during the review
- [x] Decide on a ~non-~ zero memory gas price (NB conformance tests fail with anything non-zero ATM).

candidates.title: MEM-851: Memory expansion gas (to feat)
candidates.body:
This is a rollup of all `MEM-*` requests that were individually a bit fragmented to review. 

The PR is still opened to a feature branch because eventually to go to master we'll have to take just the gas related code, not the conformance tests which won't work on master.

candidates.title: add support for actor events.
candidates.body:
Reference implementation of https://github.com/filecoin-project/FIPs/pull/483.
Part of #1048.

## TODO
- [x] Make events AMT root in Receipt optional.
- [x] Implement gas handling.
- [ ] ~Validate that values in event entries are valid DAG-CBOR.~
	- Moved to #1082.
- [ ] ~Macro for emitting events.~
	- P3, not necessary at this stage; will be more impactful with native actors (M2.2).

candidates.title: EVM-891: HAMT link extension
candidates.body:
part of https://github.com/filecoin-project/ref-fvm/issues/891

## Description

The PR adds an option to the HAMT to use _extensions_ in `Pointer::Link` to skip levels in the tree where the keys would map into the same bucket. This is not enabled by default because with the default `Sha256` hashing this is probably not an issue, and also for backwards compatibility on the CID level. It's being added to support the HAMT as a backend for the EVM, where the Solidity compiler already applies hashing on the keys plus an offset to put array entries next to each other. 

As a first step we circumvented the HAMT hashing in the EVM actor in https://github.com/filecoin-project/builtin-actors/pull/730
As the charts showed this resulted in very deep trees for arrays, where most levels apart from the bottom only contain a single pointer. This PR should see those trees shrink, the number of reads and writes go down. 

Since then we discussed that potentially the AMT would also be a viable data structure for this purpose, if it had similar skipping to what's being added here. If the EVM switched to AMT, I'm not sure how much value is in the HAMT having the skip feature. It's relevant based on the hashing strategy that the user implements.

## Changes
- [x] Add a `hamt::Config` to contain `bit_width` and a new `use_extensions` flag. Disabled by default.
- [x] If extensions are enabled, find the longest prefix in keys once a bucket is filled up and a subshard needs to be created.
- [x] During searches/deletes, check if a key matches the extension in the link. If not, don't retrieve the node from the store.
- [x] Use `Ipld::Map` for serialization of `Pointer::Link` _iff_ there is a non-empty extension in it.
- [x] Refactored unit tests to allow different HAMT configurations
- [x] Added fuzz tests for the extensions using the same corpora as the simple case 

## Notes

I saw that the `depth` was recently removed from the recursive methods, however I wanted to keep it until I can try another optimisation in https://github.com/filecoin-project/ref-fvm/issues/892

In retrospect it would have been much simpler to store the list of indexes in the `Extension` at each level, which would have made splitting easier. I decided early on to use bit packing instead based on how `HashBits` works to save storage space; if the `bit_width` is much smaller than 8 this would result in fewer number of bytes in the `path` than if we stored numbers. At the time I thought about storing indexes as `u32` which `next` returns, but that would have made no sense actually since it always fits an `u8`, so the actual difference might not be that much; definitely not with the default `bit_width` where it's identical.
